intro: Vincetoxicum cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a perennial vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. Its growth habit includes climbing or trailing stems that can reach several meters in length. Vincetoxicum cordatum is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
